Recruitment and Workforce Services in the US & Beyond

We are powerful global network, connecting the most talented and experienced specialists with reputable clients in the US, and beyond.

 

Our presence spans over 120+ offices and our name is represented by more than 12,000 specialists around the world. We deliver skilled talent and workforce services that transform projects in Life Sciences, Conventional Energy, Mining, and Renewable Energy. Our services, including contract hire, direct hire, RPO, and more, are trusted by the most respected names in various industries and are backed by a long history of success.

 

We have joined forces with Taylor Hopkinson, a trusted recruitment partner to renewable energy leaders. By connecting Brunel’s extensive global foot-print with Taylor Hopkinson’s deep sector knowledge, network and track record, we set a new benchmark for service and quality within the full life cycle of renewables projects.

Explore Our Services

Workforce Solutions

Do you sometimes struggle to improve productivity and achieve organizational goals while also optimizing your workforce management? Brunel leverages advanced recruitment techniques and strategic workforce planning to streamline talent acquisition and enhance your overall performance.

Global Mobility Solutions

Have you ever tried to master the complexities of international workforce mobility while solving the logistical nightmare of getting your teams to ten different places? Brunel seamlessly transfers individuals, teams and even whole businesses wherever they are needed – from the next state or region to the farthest corners of the planet.

Project & Consulting Solutions

You are committed to delivering projects that meet the highest quality standards with full legal compliance. But how do you do that safely, on time and on budget, every time? Brunel provides the custom support, international network and local knowledge that your projects need to thrive.

We are one of the World's Best Companies 2024

We are proud that Brunel has been named one of the “World’s Best Companies 2024” by TIME magazine and Statista. This recognition, based on rigorous criteria including employee satisfaction, revenue growth, and ESG performance, highlights our commitment to quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction. It sets us apart in our industry, enhancing our reputation and fostering trust and loyalty among our clients and specialists.

Peter de Laat,

Brunel CEO

Brunel is committed to excellence that grows out of our core values: an entrepreneurial spirit, a results-driven mindset, a passion for people and the highest standards of integrity. Living out these values day in, day out, our global network of specialists fosters a culture of collaboration that drives both your success and ours.

5 Tips to Optimize Your Resume with Chat GPT

Creating a resume that catches the attention of recruiters and hiring managers is essential for job-seekers. However, it can be challenging to articulate your skills and experiences in a compelling way. At Brunel, we frequently vet resources for our contractors and candidates to improve their resumes. This is where Chat GPT comes in - an AI-powered language model that can serve as a free ai resume reviewer to stand out from the crowd. In this blog, we'll explore how to leverage the new AI Chat GPT to create an AI-Optimized Resume. Follow the Brunel blog to get the best resume tips from recruiters and more.

Power Up: Take Part in the Transition to Renewable Energy

As the world moves towards cleaner energy sources, many experienced electrical engineers in the Oil and Gas industry are looking to transition to renewable energy. While there may be some differences between Oil & and Gas and the renewable energy sector, many of the skills and knowledge that electrical engineers have developed in their careers are transferable and can make the switch smoother. In this article, we will explore some tips for electrical engineers interested in renewable energy engineering jobs.

Life Sciences

Beware of scammers impersonating Brunel recruiters

A fraudulent scam impacting candidates has been brought to our attention. The scammers are pretending to be working as Brunel recruiters. These individuals will offer job opportunities and in many cases will provide fake documents appearing that the job opportunities are with Brunel. The documents might even have the Brunel logo, or entity names. Interested candidates are required to pay a (refundable) fee. In some cases, the scammers will try to explain that the fees are necessary to cover cost for medical tests or visa applications. After receiving the fee, all activity stops, and no (genuine) job is offered.

 

We want to highlight that these individuals do not represent Brunel, nor have we given them a recruitment assignment. Brunel will never require candidates to pay (upfront) fees in order to be eligible for a job opportunity.

 

We strongly recommend to anybody that receives such an offer or request, or worse, has paid the fee, to contact your local authorities and file a report, and stop all interactions with the individuals involved. To help us stop these type of activities and the abuse of our brand, please also inform us via info@brunelinternational.net.

 

Read more about how to identify scamming.
